channel.title: Memory Usage Regarding Rsca base
channel.description:
I am getting a VM memory outage error. I am running on a decent sized Vps, so I believe that there is no problem on my computer specs. So if that is true, what would I have to change to get the server to not return this error. Would it be in build.xml? That is the only place I could think to start looking for a fix.
[url=http://postimage.org/image/fwsjz43o/][img]http://s1.postimage.org/fwsjz43o/untitled.jpg[/img][/url]

item.title: Memory Usage Regarding Rsca base
item.dc:creator: @Stealmojo Stealmojo
item.description:
@Stealmojo wrote:

I got it, I do have enough memory but figured lowering would help. Actually what I had to do was delete the ones in build that I wasn’t using. Worked fine after that.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory Usage Regarding Rsca base
item.dc:creator: @Stealmojo Stealmojo
item.description:
@Stealmojo wrote:

My server is running through p2p – I have also tried changing the values of all of them. I still get the same error.

[code]

<property name="src" location="src" />
<property name="build" location="build" />
<property name="doc" location="../doc" />
<property name="lib" location="lib" />
<property name="jar" location="rscd.jar" />
<property name="settings" location="settings.ini" />
<property name="quests" location="conf/server/quests" />

<target name="compile">
	<delete file="${jar}" />
	<delete dir="${build}" />
	<mkdir dir="${build}" />
	<javac srcdir="${src}" destdir="${build}" debug="on" target="1.5">
	  <classpath>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar"/>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/pircbot.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/bsh.jar" />

		<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar"/>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/jmf.jar" />
		<pathelement path="${java.class.path}/"/>
	  </classpath>
	</javac>
	<jar basedir="${build}" destfile="${jar}" />
	
</target>

<target name="doc" depends="compile">
	<javadoc sourcepath="${src}" destdir="${doc}" verbose="on" />
</target>

<target name="map">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.server.util.MapGenerator" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<arg value="map.png" />
		<arg value="${world}.conf" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />

<target name="runls">
	<java classname="rsca.ls.Server" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx242m" />
		<arg value="ls.conf" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />

<target name="runspriteeditor">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.spriteeditor.SpriteEditor" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Memory Usage Regarding Rsca base
item.dc:creator: @Stealmojo Stealmojo
item.description:
@Stealmojo wrote:

Yes but changing the values there just return different memory errors, i figured i would have to change them through the java cp and not the server

Update Ok so I have spent a few hours trying and testing various methods to get this my ls and server to run together without throwing out the memory error. I can’t grasp what else I am supposed to do.
I have tried to go through java cp and my build.xml, each unsuccessful. The only thing I have managed to do is to get it to throw a bigger memory error. If someone could please just check it out over teamview and let me know if I am wasting my time, I’d appreciate it. I really think I need to get a upgraded vps in order for this to work. I guess my Vps is only 512mb.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory Usage Regarding Rsca base
item.dc:creator: @Stealmojo Stealmojo
item.description:
@Stealmojo wrote:

I have tried that, but still I am getting different or the same memory outage errors. Maybe I am doing it wrong. Could I please get a little more direction as to what I need to do exactly to raise my memory size.

When trying to add memory what class file would i allocate in my command? Here is what I am currently trying.

java -Xms64m -Xmx256m Server.class

this was a shot in the dark, if I am doing it totally wrong, just let me know. This is starting to get frustrating.

I am starting to believe this is some kind of memory leak, I can run ls or server, just not together. I can’t however run the simple Sprite Editor. When I click my sprites.rscd I get the dumb memory error also.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory Usage Regarding Rsca base
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Increase your JVM heap space while compiling/running.

Read full topic
